captions.text: A Control Enthusiast's Guide to Life
Has a young gentleman caller been inquiring about the apple of your eye? That's too bad.
But, handled correctly, your daughter’s first date can be a guaranteed success. For you.
First, welcome the suitor with open arms and invite him in for a scotch.
If he takes it, before he takes her out, throw him out. Problem solved.
But if he sidesteps that one, find any common household item that you can use as a menacing prop -
or a toilet plunger—I’m just spitballin’ here—
and then launch into a free-form soliloquy  on responsibility and respect
while off-handedly mentioning the fact that during the course of your career you’ve had to go to some dark...
Or something like that. Anyway, in full disclosure,
I must tell you that your daughter will hate you.
It ain't for the faint of heart.

title: Daughter's First Date - Patrick Warburton Control Enthusiast

comments.text: Negan is coming.﻿
comments.author: mockingbird rich

comments.text: Mr. Barkin?﻿
comments.author: Jessie Herron

comments.text:
As to the full disclosure at the end, "your daughter will hate you..."
Parents are supposed to be the children's parents, not their BFFs.
As to fathers, if your teenage daughter doesn't hate you or at least think 
you are not cool (unless the daughter is mature and wise beyond her years 
), then you are doing something very wrong.
Clean that gun, or if no gun, definitely brandish casually the bat or golf 
club.
 A picture is worth a thousand words.
Put the fear of you in the young man.﻿
